meanings.definition: A person who makes something more humane or compassionate.
meanings.sent1: The humanizer at the animal shelter always ensures the animals are well taken care of.
meanings.sent2: The humanizer's presence in the hospital brought comfort to the patients.
meanings.sent3: The humanizer at the orphanage always has a smile on their face, brightening up the children's day.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness acted as a humanizer, softening even the toughest hearts.
meanings.sent5: The humanizer's impact on the community was truly remarkable.

meanings.definition: To make something more humane or compassionate.
meanings.sent1: She decided to humanize the workplace by introducing flexible working hours.
meanings.sent2: The teacher's efforts to humanize the classroom environment were appreciated by the students.
meanings.sent3: He humanized the situation by offering a helping hand to those in need.
meanings.sent4: Her words had the power to humanize even the most challenging discussions.
meanings.sent5: The organization's new policy aimed to humanize the treatment of its employees.
